intro: Indosasa jinpingensis, commonly known as the Jinping indosasa, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. It has lanceolate leaves and produces small, blue-violet flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
